articles.title: Kim Jong Un Guides Enlarged Meeting of CMC of WPK
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Guides Enlarged Meeting of CMC of WPK
						
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- An enlarged meeting of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea was held under the guidance of Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the WPK, chairman of the CMC of the WPK, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					 Present there were members of the CMC of the WPK, executive members of the party committee of the KPA and commanding officers of the services and corps-level units of the KPA.
					
					 The meeting discussed issues arising in more thoroughly establishing the monolithic leadership system of the party in the whole army, bolstering up the combat readiness and capabilities of the KPA in every way and decisively improving the living of the service personnel as required by the prevailing situation and the developing revolution and important matters arising in increasing the defense capability of the country.
					
					 It discussed an organizational issue.
					
					 Kim Jong Un analyzed and reviewed the work of the People's Army last year and set forth the important tasks to be carried out by it this year and ways to do so. 
					
					 The meeting held in the stirring period when all the service personnel and people of the DPRK are raising a strong wind of leap forward in all fields for building a thriving nation full of confidence in victory will mark an important occasion in further strengthening the KPA as an invincible revolutionary Paektusan army and firmly protecting the country's security and sovereignty under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Enjoys Performance Given by Moranbong Band
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Enjoys Performance Given by Moranbong Band
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, enjoyed a performance given by the Moranbong Band together with service personnel of the KPA.
					 Put on the stage were diverse numbers including female chorus "People's joy", female solo "O My motherland full of  hope", female duet and pangchang "Our father" and female solo and pangchang "Song of high haul in sea."
					
					 The artistes sang high praises of the immortal revolutionary exploits Kim Jong Un has performed by steering the struggle for defending the socialist motherland and building a rich and powerful country through forced march for field guidance day and night and the indomitable spirit of the service personnel and people of the DPRK demonstrating the might of the great Paektusan nation, united close around him.
					
					 They, at the same time, powerfully demonstrated that the future of Songun Korea always remain bright and rosy as Kim Jong Un is standing at the helm of the Korean revolution and there is no force on earth that can block the advance of all the service personnel and people ushering in a new period of prosperity in the great era of Kim Jong Un under the wise leadership of the WPK.
					
					 At the end of the performance he waved back to the enthusiastic cheers of the audience and performers and congratulated them on their successful performance.
					
					 He expressed his expectation and conviction that the creators and artistes of the band would more dynamically create art works and conduct performing activities to encourage the service personnel and people of the DPRK to bring about a great surge in the great drive for building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Among the audience were Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Gil, Jang Jong Nam, Kim Won Hong, Choe Pu Il, Han Kwang Sang, Kim Kyong Ok, Hwang Pyong So, Hong Yong Chil, Ma Won Chun and Kim Yo Jong.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Guides Firing Competition
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Guides Firing Competition
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, guided a firing competition among commanding officers of the services and corps-level units.
					 The competition was divided into the group of military officers and the group of political officers.
					
					 The participants competed in firing pistols and automatic rifles to hit the targets at fixed distance and time. Winners were decided by points.
					
					 The group of military officers came first in the pistol-firing while the group of political officers placed first in the automatic rifle-firing and the former emerged a winner in team standing.
					
					 And then the competition was reviewed and the successful participants were estimated.
					
					 He underscored the need for the KPA to conduct a dynamic campaign for training soldiers as crack shots so that they may be prepared as crack shots capable of hitting at a single shot any target under any circumstances, regardless of weather in day and night time and seasons, adding that to this end the commanding officers should become crack shots before any others. 
					
					 Underlining the need to thoroughly apply the five-point training policy and the four-point training principle of the party and thus make the training more intensive as the anti-Japanese guerrillas did in Mt. Paektu, bearing deep in mind the party's intention of organizing the above-said competition, he stressed that it is necessary to use the competition as an important occasion in training all soldiers as crack shots.
					
					 He posed for a picture with the participants in the contest after expressing expectation and belief that the commanding officers of the services and corps-level units and all other commanding officers of the KPA would put the greatest spurs to rounding up combat preparations and thus creditably perform the heavy yet honorable combat duties assigned to them by the party, always bearing in mind that a combat starts without any advertisement.
					
					 Among the spectators were members of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, executive members of the party committee of the KPA, and its other commanding officers.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Guides Flight Exercise
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Guides Flight Exercise
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, guided the flight exercise of the KPA Air and Anti-Air Force Unit 188 honored with the title of O Jung Hup-led 7th Regiment.
					 He was greeted by KPA Air Force General Ri Pyong Chol, commander of the KPA Air and Anti-Air Force, and commanding officers of the unit.
					
					 He issued an order to start the flight exercise.
					
					 Aircraft took off with whirr and thunder shaking the land.
					
					 The flying corps suddenly flew up to be out of sight but zoomed down in a twinkle to pound the "enemy's" position. They strikingly demonstrated the militant stamina of the brave pilots ready to blow up the enemy position like lightening over Mt. Paektu and to blast the enemy's stronghold like a thunder over Jong Il Peak once an order is issued.
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the pilots successfully performed their combat duties.
					
					 Noting that the drill was successful, he emphasized that the sky of the country would be always azure and blue thanks to the airmen reliably defending the inviolable territorial air of the socialist motherland in the spirit of becoming human bombs.
					
					 He instructed the commanding officers to intensify training to prepare the airmen as members of death-defying corps in the sky and able combat pilots capable of successfully fighting a modern warfare.
					
					 After highly praising the airmen of the unit for getting always fully ready to go into action, he had a photo taken with them.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Gil, Jang Jong Nam, Kim Won Hong, Choe Pu Il, Han Kwang Sang, Kim Kyong Ok, Hwang Pyong So, Hong Yong Chil and Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Special Envoy of Chinese Government Here
articles.content:
Special Envoy of Chinese Government Here 
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Wu Dawei, special envoy of the Chinese government for the affairs of the Korean peninsula, and his party arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: New Kind of Fur-prevention Device Developed
articles.content:
New Kind of Fur-prevention Device Developed
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Chemical Engineering Institute under the State Academy of Sciences has developed a magnetization device for prevention of fur.
					 The device made of permanent magnet is especially effective in preventing boiler pipes from being covered with fur as its strong magnetism changes physical characters of water.
					
					 Its installation reduces fuel consumption by 5 to 20 percent and does not need reagent, salt and cation-exchange resin when cleaning pipes.
					
					 The device has already been introduced in boilers at the February 8 Vinalon Complex, the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex and other industrial establishments to help operate them at full capacity.

articles.title: Kim Ji Hyang, DPRK Woman Marathoner
articles.content:
Kim Ji Hyang, DPRK Woman Marathoner
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, Kim Ji Hyang, 19 years old marathoner of the DPRK, finished first at the Chinese Taipei International Marathon.
					 She was the youngest of those runners in the marathon.
					
					 Though it was rainy and windy, Kim took the lead from the start.
					
					 At the moment when she was approaching the 30-km spot of the course, she rapidly forced the pace, giving a wide berth to her Ethiopian rival running close on her heels.
					
					  Even in the last gradient section, she gradually increased her running speed beyond the imagination of spectators.
					
					 Thus, she won the first place, setting new record of the race.

articles.title: Week of Russian Film Show Opens in DPRK
articles.content:
Week of Russian Film Show Opens in DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- A Week of Russian film show opened to mark the 65th anniversary of the agreement on economic and cultural cooperation between the DPRK and the Russian Federation.
					 An opening ceremony was held at the Taedongmun Cinema on Monday.
					
					 Present there were Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is chairman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association, officials concerned and citizens.
					
					 Alexandr Timonin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Speakers referred to the fact that the two countries have covered the road of steady development over the past 65 years, supporting and cooperating with each other in the fields of the economy and culture in the spirit of the agreement.
					
					 They stressed that the friendly relations between the DPRK and Russia are being carried forward under the deep care of supreme leader Kim Jong Un and President Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin.
					
					 Then the participants watched the Russian film "Star".
					
					 A reception was given at the Russian consulate general in Chongjin on the same day.

articles.title: New Posters Produced
articles.content:
New Posters Produced 
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House produced new posters encouraging the service personnel and people of the country to implement the party's policies. 
					 A poster "Let us bring about great surge in agricultural production this year!" depicts agricultural workers full of confidence of a decisive boost in the agricultural production. It bears letters "Main thrust" with the vast field of a co-operative farm in the background. 
					
					 There is also a poster "Let us usher in a period of great prosperity in construction true to the leadership of the great party!". It reflects the ardent enthusiasm of the officials and workers in the field of construction to take the lead in bringing about a fresh florescence of civilization in the 21st century by effecting innovations in the construction.

articles.title: U.S. Is Not Entitled to Blame DPRK for Its Nukes: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Is Not Entitled to Blame DPRK for Its Nukes: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- For the U.S. to accuse the DPRK of its access to its nuclear deterrent is nothing but sheer sophism as the former insists on its far-fetched assertion in disregard of the basic reason why the nuclear issue was spawned and the ensuing consequences, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article.
					 It is none other than the U.S. which compelled the DPRK to have nuclear deterrence, the article notes, explaining the reason to say so. It goes on:
					
					 The DPRK's access to nukes put an end to the nuclear imbalance in Northeast Asia and remarkably decreased the danger of war on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The U.S., however, claims that the situation got strained on the Korean peninsula due to the DPRK's access to nukes and it was compelled to pursue a hostile policy toward the latter. This is, indeed, a brigandish assertion which reminds one of a guilty party filing the suit first.
					
					 It is nothing but a petty trick U.S. has employed to justify its hostile policy toward the DPRK, stoke a global atmosphere of pressure upon the latter and thus stifle it.
					
					 The U.S. behavior goes to clearly prove that it remains unchanged in its hostile policy toward the DPRK but has become evermore undisguised.
					
					 Now that the U.S. is desperately pursuing its hostile policy toward the DPRK, blaming it for its access to nukes through the profound confusing of the right and wrong, clear is its principled stand on its access to the nuclear deterrence.
					
					 As nukes of the DPRK serve as its all-powerful treasured sword for protecting the sovereignty and security of the country, no one is entitled to blame it for them as long as the U.S. nuclear threat against it and hostile policy toward it persist.

articles.title: U.S. Slammed for Driving Inter-Korean Relations to Catastrophe
articles.content:
U.S. Slammed for Driving Inter-Korean Relations to Catastrophe
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The U.S. has staged large-scale war exercises targeting the DPRK in south Korea every year, steadily pursuing its hostile policy toward the latter. This has extremely escalated tensions on the Korean peninsula and driven the inter-Korean relations into a catastrophe.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says this in an article.
					
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The U.S. has often said that it supports improved inter-Korean relations but, in actuality, it has worked overtly and covertly to spoil the efforts for their improvement, displeased with the north and the south getting reconciled and advancing toward reunification hand in hand.
					
					 This is evidenced by the fact that at a time when the discussion was under way for the reunion of separated families and relatives from the north and the south, the U.S. let B-52s fly into the sky above Jik islet in the West Sea of Korea for a nuclear strike drill targeting the north and put pressure upon the south Korean authorities not to opt for mending the north-south relations in haste.
					
					 Not content with it, the U.S. is now expanding the scale of the on-going Foal Eagle joint military drills on a daily basis in a bid to completely spoil the inter-Korean relations. 
					
					 Had the U.S. canceled Key Resolve and Foal Eagle as demanded by the DPRK, a decisive phase would have been created in improving the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 What matters is that the U.S., which has persistently pursued its hostile policy toward the DPRK, never hopes for improved inter-Korean relations.
					
					 The fact goes to clearly prove that there would be neither the improvement of north-south relations nor durable peace on the Korean peninsula unless the U.S. heinous hostile policy toward the DPRK is terminated.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Show Will to Mend Inter-Korean Relations through Practical Actions
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Show Will to Mend Inter-Korean Relations through Practical Actions
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Yu Song Ok, director of the Institute for Security Strategy under the Intelligence Service of south Korea, in a special lecture before lawmakers from the "Saenuri Party" on Mar. 11 slandered the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 It is the worst insult and provocation against the inviolable dignity of the supreme leadership and social system of the DPRK.
					
					 The incident of hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership goes to clearly prove once again that the Intelligence Service of south Korea is a den of evils of those hell-bent on plot-breeding and the confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 The confrontational plotters of south Korea are trying to test the DPRK, which proposed stopping mud-slinging, in such a way of using baits one by one after setting stages of media, civic organizations, authorities and experts. 
					
					 The DPRK is showing greatest self-restraint, regarding it as the first footstep for improving inter-Korean relations to stop slandering the other side. This aims to defuse distrust and confrontation between the north and the south at an early date and opt for reconciliation, cooperation and reunification, not to leave the abnormal north-south relations intact while remaining a passive onlooker to the provocative acts of the other side.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should not talk about confidence but show their will to mend the north-south ties through practical actions, though belatedly.

articles.title: News Analyst on U.S. Smear Campaign over Human Rights
articles.content:
News Analyst on U.S. Smear Campaign over Human Rights
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the U.S. ambassador to south Korea said that "the human rights situation in north Korea is deplorable." And he called for tightened sanctions on the DPRK, saying that what U.S. Secretary of State Kerry termed the DPRK to slander it is not so excessive expression.
					 It is not an eye-opener that an ambassador of the U.S. talked about "evil", in the wake of Kerry and Bush, incarnations of evil. 
					
					 Such slanders only show how the U.S. administration is worrying itself about the human rights issues in its country.
					
					 The U.S. is the world's worst human rights abuser, as unanimously mentioned by the world people over its recent "report on human rights situation in the world".
					
					 The human rights records in the U.S. have already reached the bottom in all items it raised in the "report" to accuse other countries for no ground. So to speak, if the names of nearly 200 countries and regions, accused in the "report", are replaced with the name of the U.S. this will precisely show the human rights situation in the U.S. In actuality, its human rights situation is more serious. 
					
					 But the U.S. ambassador to south Korea dared to slander other country over the human rights issue.
					
					 If he had told correctly about what he saw and heard while staying in south Korea as an ambassador, he might have been called a person of somewhat prudence. But, he has kept mum about facts -- ceaseless assaults by GIs, a faked-up spy case based on false documents of a third country, and abduction of DPRK citizens that happened in south Korea after he took office as an ambassador -- to say nothing of the happenings witnessed by him in the past ten-odd years of engagement in the Korean Peninsula issue.
					
					 It is clear that the U.S. is behind such human rights abuses and the ambassador representing the U.S. interests is directly involved in those cases. 
					
					 There is a saying that curses, like chickens, come home to roost. The U.S. accusations against other countries will only put itself to shame. 
					
					 It had better improve its ugly image as the worst human rights violator, before anything else.

articles.title: News Analysis on Japan's Impudent Conducts
articles.content:
News Analysis on Japan's Impudent Conducts
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Japan is now getting hell-bent on the moves to beautify its blood-stained history of aggression.
					 A movie, themed with a member of Kamikaze (suicide attack squad) of the Imperial Japanese Army, has been publicly screened in the country. Timing with it, an application was filed with the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) for listing as world's heritage a note and a letter written by a Kamikaze member, which is preserved at a hall of Kagoshima Prefecture.
					
					 Such fanaticism is evoking a wave of outcry in the international community as it represents Japan's wrong view of history.
					
					 Japan is a war criminal and defeated nation that inflicted untold misfortune and pains upon Asian people in the last century.
					
					 Its ultra-right forces have argued that the Pacific War was not for aggression and it was aimed to "liberate" Asian countries. They even asserted that the Pacific War led Asian countries to be independent from Europe's colonial rule and that Japan did a "good job" during its colonial rule over Korea.
					
					 This time, the Japanese reactionaries are seeking to beautify their crime-woven history as "praiseworthy" in the world even by making sport of UNESCO. They consider the listing will help Japan embellish its history of aggression and flee from its responsibility for the settlement of the past.
					
					 Japan's attempt to abuse a UN body is evidently an insult and mockery of justice and human conscience, to say nothing of the Korean nation.
					
					 UNESCO is not a criminal organization that will join Japan in its scheme to whitewash the past crimes.
					
					 Japan should be mindful that its sinister attempt will only reveal its dirty colors.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Deplores Society Riddled with Lies, Fabrications
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Deplores Society Riddled with Lies, Fabrications
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- An editorial titled "Fabrications lead to collapse" was posted on the south Korean internet paper Voice of People on March 14.
					 The editorial recalled that recently a lawmaker said that the present chief executive was elected by gaining votes through various false commitments made during the last "presidential" election campaign. 
					
					 The above-said confession made by the lawmaker who played a main role in the election of the chief executive is drawing public attention, the editorial said, and went on:
					
					 There is an increasing suspicion as to whether the "Saenuri Party" cooked up even the election results as one fabrication is apt to be followed by another one. 
					
					 A typical example is the suspicion that pre-arranged election results were broadcast by a broadcasting service before the final results of the voting were available. 
					
					 The situation has reached such a pass where the present regime is under fire for having cooked up an attempted rebellion in a bid to tide over the political crisis caused by its seizure of power through "government" bodies' illegal interference in the election. 
					
					 When a spy case broke out at last only to turn out to be a fabrication, people are infuriated by this news. Much upset by this, the chief executive insists she has nothing to do with the case. 
					
					 Querying where is the end of fabrications, the editorial continued:
					
					 As is the case with the shocking incident in which a gymnasium in Kyongju City, North Kyongsang Province collapsed recently as it was built by a construction company and an official of the City Office on the basis of the fabricated official document, a fabrication finally leads to a collapse and the same is the case with the regime.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye's Rough Remarks Censured in S. Korea
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye's Rough Remarks Censured in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- An editorial titled "Rough remarks of the president getting serious with each passing day" was posted on the south Korean internet newspaper Voice of People on March 13.
					 The editorial said that the chief executive has recently let loose a string of rough, provocative and belligerent remarks which were often heard during the Park Chung-Hee and Chun Doo Hwan dictatorial regimes. It went on:
					
					 This is the reflection of her irritated and uneasy mentality. The remarks regarding the people as the target of order, not as one of understanding, make the people feel uneasy.
					
					 What is more serious is that she talks nonsense contrary to the situation in which the people call for disbanding the Intelligence Service (IS) making innocent people spies in broad daylight.
					
					 The ruler's remarks are getting rougher as their validity is dwindling day after day.
					
					 Rising is the people's resentment at the IS's fabrication of the spy case which has already been disclosed, but she is letting loose a spate of incoherent words and repeating provocative remarks. This is stirring up the people's resentment only.
					
					 To conceal the truth and deceive the people will invite greater resentment and resistance, the editorial warned.

articles.title: Swiss Organizations Congratulate Korean People on Their Successful Election of Deputies to SPA
articles.content:
Swiss Organizations Congratulate Korean People on Their Successful Election of Deputies to SPA
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on March 10 as regards the successful election of the deputies to the 13th Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.
					 The statement said that supreme leader Kim Jong Un visited Kim Il Sung University of Politics, took part in the election of a deputy to the SPA together with service personnel of the Korean People's Army and voted for a unit commander of the KPA, a candidate for a deputy to the SPA.
					
					 The election marked a significant occasion in consolidating as firm as a rock the people's power built and developed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Through the election the Korean people fully demonstrated again the might of single-minded unity of them rallied close around their leader and their unshakable will to firmly consolidate and glorify socialism centred on the popular masses.
					
					 It is ridiculous that the U.S. and the Western media following it slander the election in the DPRK.
					
					 The election in the capitalist society is the money-almighty one and the polling station is a place for fight of a handful of the ruling circles, the rich and those in power.
					
					 But in socialist Korea candidates of all social strata representing the interests of the people are elected deputies.
					
					 Most of the candidates are service personnel, workers, farmers, intellectuals and women hold significant proportion.
					
					 We extend warm congratulations to the Korean people on their successful election.

articles.title: Statement of KPA Strategic Force Spokesman Supported by Personage of International Body
articles.content:
Statement of KPA Strategic Force Spokesman Supported by Personage of International Body
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Alejandro Cao de Benos, chairman of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain, issued a statement on March 9 in support of the statement of the spokesman for the Strategic Force of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 The statement said that the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military maneuvers staged by the U.S. and south Korea every year pose the greatest threats to peace and security on the Korean peninsula and in Northeast Asia.
					
					 The U.S., which has its roots in all kinds of crimes, racism and slave system, should stop at once encroaching upon the sovereignty of the DPRK and interfering in its internal affairs and pay attention to the human rights abuses in the U.S., it said, and went on:
					
					 The strength of the service personnel and people of the DPRK united close around their leader is more powerful than any weapon in the world.
					
					 The moves to bring down the people's power of the DPRK are doomed to a bitter failure.
					
					 The DPRK is a full-fledged nuclear weapons state whether others recognize it or not.
					
					 The U.S. has access to a large number of modern weapons but the U.S. imperialist aggression forces will be nothing but a group of dastardly criminals in the confrontation with the heroic service personnel of the Korean People's Army, the strongest army in the world, once a war breaks out.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Off Press in Dominica
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Off Press in Dominica
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's works were brought out in booklet by a publishing house in Dominica on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The works are "The Great Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and People" and "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party."
					
					 The first work, published on April 20, Juche 101 (2012), deals with the revolutionary feats President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed all their lives and the tasks for firmly defending and eternally glorifying their ideology and feats.
					
					 The second work, published on April 6, Juche 101 (2012), says that holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem as eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea is a principled requirement to victoriously advance the cause of the Korean revolution. It also clarifies the tasks for steadily developing the WPK into the glorious party of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Nigeria
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Nigeria
 Pyongyang, March 17 (KCNA) -- A Nigerian national preparatory committee for celebrating the 102nd birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (Day of the Sun) was formed in Abuja on Mar. 11.
					 Ibrahim Mantu who is a member of the Credit Committee of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria and chairman of the Nigeria-DPRK Friendship Association was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to hold colorful political and cultural events to widely introduce the brilliant revolutionary career of the President and his undying feats on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige la reunion ampliada de la CMC del PTC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige la reunion ampliada de la CMC del PTC
						
Pyongyang, 17 de marzo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar la reunion ampliada de la Comision Militar Central (CMC) del Partido del Trabajo de Corea bajo la direccion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del PTC, Presidente de la CMC del PTC, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea (EPC).
					Asistieron a la ocasion los miembros de la CMC del PTC, los miembros ejecutivos del Comite del PTC en el EPC y los comandantes de tipos de ejercito y de unidades a nivel de cuerpo.
					
					El conclave discutio y aprobo el problema de establecer con mas firmeza el sistema de direccion unica del partido sobre todo el ejercito conforme a la situacion creada y la demanda de la revolucion en desarrollo, el de fortalecer por todos los medios los preparativos y la capacidad de combate del EPC y el de mejorar resueltamente las condiciones de vida de los uniformados y otros asuntos importantes que se presentan para consolidar el poderio defensivo del pais.
					
					Tambien fue debatido el problema de organizacion.
					
					El Mariscal hizo balance de los trabajos del ano pasado del EPC e indico las tareas programaticas y los medios a ser mantenidos este ano por el EPC.
					
					La reunion ampliada de la CMC del PTC, que se realizo en el tiempo conmovedor en que con la conviccion en la victoria, todo el ejercito y todo el pueblo registran grandes saltos en todos los dominios de la construccion de un Estado prospero, servira de importante oportunidad para intensificar el EPC como el invencible ejercito revolucionario del monte Paektu y defender con firmeza la seguridad y la soberania del pais bajo la sabia direccion del Mariscal.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un presencia funcion de Banda Moranbong
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un presencia funcion de Banda Moranbong
Pyongyang, 17 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, presencio junto con los oficiales y soldados del EPC la funcion de la Banda Moranbong.
					En la escena se pusieron el coro femenino "Jubilo del pueblo", el solo femenino "Mi patria llena de esperanzas", el duo femenino y pangchang "Nuestro padre", el solo femenino y pangchang "Cancion de abundante pesca en el mar" y otras piezas.
					
					Las ejecutantes describieron en tono patetico las inmortales hazanas revolucionarias del Comandante Supremo quien en la continua marcha forzada de la incansable direccion en el terreno, orienta a la cabeza la defensa de la patria socialista y la construccion de un Estado prospero, y el impetu indoblegable del ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC que unidos compactamente en torno a el, demuestran a todo el mundo el poderio de la potencia del monte Paektu.
					
					La funcion demostro con vigor que sera siempre radiante el futuro de Corea del Songun gracias a enaltecer al Comandante Supremo al frente de la revolucion y que nadie podra detener el avance del ejercito y el pueblo coreanos que abren una nueva era dorada de la gran epoca de Kim Jong Un.
					
					Terminada la funcion, el Mariscal felicito el exito de la funcion respondiendo con la mano alzada a las efusivas aclamaciones de los espectadores y ejecutantes.
					
					Expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que los creadores y artistas de la Banda Moranbong desarrollaran con mas dinamismo la creacion y la funcion artisticas para estimular al ejercito y el pueblo que registran un gran auge en la construccion de un Estado prospero socialista.
					
					Le acompanaron en verla Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Gil, Jang Jong Nam, Kim Won Hong, Choe Pu Il, Han Kwang Sang, Kim Kyong Ok, Hwang Pyong So, Hong Yong Chil, Ma Won Chun y Kim Yo Jong.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige competencia de tiro de comandantes de EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige competencia de tiro de comandantes de EPC
						
Pyongyang, 17 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio la competencia de tiro de los comandantes de tipos de ejercito y de unidades a nivel de cuerpo.
					La competencia se desarrollo dividida en el grupo de comandantes militares y el de los politicos. Ellos compitieron por la victoria con las notas alcanzadas con la pistola y el fusil automatico en la distancia y el tiempo fijados.
					
					En la competencia de pistola gano el grupo de comandantes militares y en la de fusil automatico, el de los politicos, y la victoria general correspondio al primer grupo.
					
					Terminada la competencia, hubo el balance y la evaluacion.
					
					El Comandante Supremo subrayo que para formar a los militares como tiradores certeros que aniquilen de un tiro los blancos sin hacer caso del clima, dia y noche y las condiciones estacionales, mediante el movimiento de tiradores infalibles en el ejercito popular, los mismos comandantes deben ser antes que nadie los tiradores perfectos.
					
					Enfatizo  que bien conscientes de la voluntad del partido que organizo la competencia de tiro de los comandantes de las unidades de tipo de ejercito y a nivel de cuerpo, los comandantes deben levantar una fuerte oleada de entrenamiento del monte Paektu en todos los lugares de ejercicios al materializar estrictamente 5 orientaciones y 4 principios de entrenamiento presentados por el partido, de manera que la presente competencia sirva de  un importante motivo en formar a los uniformados como buenos tiradores.
					
					El Comandante Supremo expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que al dar acicate a los preparativos del combate sin olvidar que el combate estalla sin la propaganda previa, los comandantes de unidades de tipo de ejercito y a nivel de cuerpo y otros del EPC deben cumplir satisfactoriamente su honrosa mision de combate, que les encarga el Partido, y tomo una foto de recuerdo junto con ellos.
					
					Vieron la competencia los miembros de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, los miembros ejecutivos del Comite del PTC en el EPC y otros comandantes del EPC.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige ejercicios de vuelo de la unidad 188
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige ejercicios de vuelo de la unidad 188
Pyongyang, 17 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio el entrenamiento de vuelo de la Unidad 188 de las fuerzas aereas y antiaereas del EPC, galardonada con el titulo de Septimo Regimiento de O Jung Hup.
					El fue acogido por el general de ejercito de las fuerzas aereas del EPC Ri Pyong Chol, comandante de las fuerzas aereas y antiaereas del EPC, y los comandantes de la unidad.
					
					El Comandante Supremo ordeno el inicio de los ejercicios. 
					
					Las escuadrillas, que se perdieron en lo alto del cielo y se precipitaron bruscamente como rayo contra la posicion del "enemigo", demostraron el impetu combativo de destruir, una vez dada la orden, la base enemiga siendo relampago del monte Paektu y devastar el bastion del enemigo cayendo como trueno del pico Jongil.
					
					El Comandante Supremo se mostro muy satisfecho de que los pilotos cumplieron plenamente con su mision de combate.
					
					Diciendo que se libraron bien los ejercicios, apunto que el cielo de la patria socialista estara siempre seguro y azul gracias a los fidedignos aviadores que defienden a riesgo de la vida el sagrado cielo jurisdiccional.
					
					Dio la indicacion de intensificar el entrenamiento de aviacion para preparar a los pilotos como los competentes que puedan hacer habilmente la guerra moderna.
					
					Evaluo altamente el hecho de que los pilotos de la unidad se mantienen en la ordinaria preparacion de combate y tomo una foto de recuerdo con ellos.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Gil, Jang Jong Nam, Kim Won Hong, Choe Pu Il, Han Kwang Sang, Kim Kyong Ok, Hwang Pyong So, Hong Yong Chil y Ma Won Chun.
